text: The South Africa U-17 women's national football team, nicknamed Bantwana, is the national team of South Africa for under 17 and is controlled by the South African Football Association. ==Competitive record== ===FIFA U-17 Women's World Cup record=== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center;" |- !colspan=9|FIFA U-17 Women's World Cup |- !colspan=9|Appearances: 2 |- !Year !Round !Position ! ! ! ! ! ! |- | 2008||colspan=8|Did not qualify |- | 2010||Group stage||16th||3||0||0||3||2||17 |- | 2012||rowspan=3 colspan=8|Did not qualify |- | 2014 |- | 2016 |- | 2018||Group stage||12th||3||0||1||2||1||10 |- !Total||Group stage||2/6||6||0||1||5||3||27 |} ===African U-17 Cup of Nations for Women record=== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center;" |- !colspan=9|African U-17 Cup of Nations for Women |- !colspan=9|Appearances: 6 |- !Year !Round !Position ! ! ! ! ! ! |- |2008||First round||–||2||2||0||2||0||3 |- bgcolor=gold |2010||Play-off round||–||6||3||1||2||25||9 |- |2012||Second round||–||4||1||2||1||7||6 |- |2013||Second round||–||2||0||1||1||4||6 |- |2016||Second round||–||2||2||0||2||0||7 |- bgcolor=gold |2018||Second round||–||4||4||0||0||17||7 |- |2020||colspan=8|To be determined |- !Total||Second round||6/6||20||12||4||8||53||35 |} *'''' *'''' ==See also== *South Africa women's national football team ==External links== *Official website Category:Women's soccer in South Africa Category:Women's national under-17 association football teams U
title: South Africa women's national under-17 football team
